detaileddescription.para: RTC is not stopped during halting mode debug
RTC is stopped during halting mode debug
Mask value to enable an event on periodic seconds
Mask value to enable an event on periodic seconds
Mask value to enable an event on periodic seconds
Mask value to enable an event on periodic seconds
Mask value to enable an event on periodic seconds
Mask value to enable an event on periodic seconds
Mask value to enable an event on periodic seconds
Events which enables interrupt request generation
Months used to program the date
Status return values for RTC low level driver
Week days used program the date

parameterdescription.para: A valid RTC event (XMC_RTC_EVENT_t) or a valid combination of logically OR'd events

simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Clears periodic and alarm event(s) status

The function sets the bitfields of CLRSR register to clear status bits in RAWSTAT and STSSR registers. Setting the value for the the RTC event(s) containing in the XMC_RTC_EVENT_t clears the corresponding status bits in RAWSTAT and STSSR registers.
None

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Disables RTC peripheral for programming its registers
Gates the peripheral clock.

simplesect.title: Related APIs:
simplesect.para: XMC_RTC_Enable(), XMC_SCU_RESET_AssertPeripheralReset()

parameterdescription.para: A valid RTC event (XMC_RTC_EVENT_t) or a valid combination of logically OR'd events

simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Disable RTC periodic and alarm event(s)

The function resets the bitfields of MSKSR register to disable interrupt generation for requested RTC event(s). Resetting the masking value for the the event(s) containing in the XMC_RTC_EVENT_t blocks the generation of the interrupt.
None

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Enables RTC peripheral for programming its registers
Ungates the peripheral clock.

simplesect.title: Related APIs:
simplesect.para: XMC_RTC_Disable(), XMC_SCU_RESET_DeassertPeripheralReset()

parameterdescription.para: A valid RTC event (XMC_RTC_EVENT_t) or a valid combination of logically OR'd events

simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Enable RTC periodic and alarm event(s)

The function sets the bitfields of MSKSR register to enable interrupt generation for requested RTC event(s). Setting the masking value for the event(s) containing in the XMC_RTC_EVENT_t leads to a generation of the interrupt.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to a constant XMC_RTC_ALARM_t structure containing the time parameters alarm seconds, alarm minutes, alarm hours, alarm days, alarm daysofweek, alarm month and alarm year.

simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Gets the RTC module alarm time value
The function gets the alarm time values from ATIM0, ATIM1 registers. See the structure XMC_RTC_ALARM_t for the valid range of alarm time value parameters.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to a constant ::tm structure containing the time parameters alarm seconds, alarm minutes, alarm hours, alarm days, alarm daysofweek, alarm month, alarm year(since 1900) and alarm days in a year in standard format.

simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Gets the RTC module alarm time value in standard format

The function gets the alarm time values from ATIM0, ATIM1 registers. See the structure XMC_RTC_ALARM_t for the valid range of alarm time value parameters. For days the valid range is (1 - Actual days of month), year (since 1900) and daysinyear (0 -365).

simplesect.title: Related APIs:
simplesect.para: XMC_RTC_SetAlarm(), XMC_RTC_GetAlarm()
None

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Gets the RTC periodic and alarm event(s) status
The function reads the bitfields of STSSR register to get the status of RTC events. Reading the value of the register STSSR gives the status of the event(s) containing in the XMC_RTC_EVENT_t.
None

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Gets the RTC module prescaler value
The function reads the CTR.DIV bitfield to get the prescalar value. The default value for the prescalar with the 32.768kHz crystal (or the internal clock) is 7FFFH for a time interval of 1 sec.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to a constant XMC_RTC_TIME_t structure containing the time parameters seconds, minutes, hours, days, daysofweek, month and year.

simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Gets the RTC module time value
The function gets the time values from TIM0, TIM1 registers. See the structure XMC_RTC_TIME_t for the valid range of time value parameters.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to a constant ::tm structure containing the time parameters seconds, minutes, hours, days, daysofweek, month, year(since 1900) and days in a year in standard format.

simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Gets the RTC module time value in standard format

The function gets the time values from TIM0, TIM1 registers. See the structure XMC_RTC_TIME_t for the valid range of time value parameters. For days the valid range is (1 - Actual days of month), year (since 1900) and daysinyear (0 -365).

simplesect.title: Related APIs:
simplesect.para: XMC_RTC_SetTime(), XMC_RTC_GetTime()

parameterdescription.para: Constant pointer to a constant XMC_RTC_CONFIG_t structure containing the time, alarm time and clock divider(prescaler) configuration.

simplesect.para: XMC_RTC_STATUS_t Always returns XMC_RTC_STATUS_OK (It contains only register assignment statements)

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Initialize the RTC peripheral
The function ungates the peripheral clock for RTC, configures internal clock divider, time and alarm values by writing to the CTR.DIV, TIM0, TIM1, ATIM0 and ATIM1 registers.
None

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Checks RTC peripheral is enabled for programming its registers
Checks peripheral clock is ungated or not.

simplesect.title: Related APIs:
simplesect.para: XMC_RTC_Enable(), XMC_RTC_Disable(), XMC_SCU_RESET_DeassertPeripheralReset(), XMC_SCU_RESET_AssertPeripheralReset()
bool true if RTC is running false if RTC is not running

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Checks the running status of the RTC
The function reads the bitfield ENB of CTR register to get the running status of RTC.

simplesect.title: Related APIs:
simplesect.para: XMC_RTC_Start(), XMC_RTC_Stop()

parameterdescription.para: Constant pointer to a constant XMC_RTC_ALARM_t structure containing the alarm time parameters alarm seconds, alarm minutes, alarm hours, alarm days, alarm daysofweek, alarm month and alarm year.

simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Sets the RTC module alarm time value
The function sets the ATIM0, ATIM1 registers with alarm time values. See the structure XMC_RTC_ALARM_t for the valid range of alarm time value parameters.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to a ::tm structure containing the time parameters alarm seconds, alarm minutes, alarm hours, alarm days, alarm daysofweek, alarm month, alarm year(since 1900) and alarm days in a year in standard format.

simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Sets the RTC module alarm time value in standard format
The function sets the alarm time values from ATIM0, ATIM1 registers.

simplesect.title: Related APIs:
simplesect.para: XMC_RTC_SetAlarm(), XMC_RTC_GetAlarm()

parameterdescription.para: Debug mode value containing in (XMC_RTC_DEBUG_MODE_t) to be set

simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Configures the RTC into running or stopping mode during halting mode debug
The function sets the CTR.SUS bitfield to configure the RTC into running or stopping mode during halting mode debug.
None

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Sets the RTC module prescaler value

The function sets the CTR.DIV bitfield to configure the prescalar value. The default value for the prescalar with the 32.768kHz crystal (or the internal clock) is 7FFFH for a time interval of 1 sec. Before setting the prescaler value RTC should be in stop mode and hibernate domain should be enabled.

simplesect.title: Related APIs:
simplesect.para: XMC_RTC_Stop(), XMC_RTC_Enable(), XMC_RTC_GetPrescaler()

parameterdescription.para: Contstant pointer to a constant XMC_RTC_TIME_t structure containing the time parameters seconds, minutes, hours, days, daysofweek, month and year.

simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Sets the RTC module time values
The function sets the TIM0, TIM1 registers with time values. The values can only be written when RTC is disabled. See the structure XMC_RTC_TIME_t for the valid range of time value parameters.

simplesect.title: Related APIs:
simplesect.para: XMC_RTC_GetTime(), XMC_RTC_Stop()

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to a ::tm structure containing the time parameters seconds, minutes, hours, days, daysofweek, month, year(since 1900) and days in a year in standard format.

simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Sets the RTC module time value in standard format
The function sets the time values from TIM0, TIM1 registers.

simplesect.title: Related APIs:
simplesect.para: XMC_RTC_SetTime(), XMC_RTC_GetTime()
None

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Enables RTC peripheral to start counting time
The function starts the RTC for counting time by setting CTR.ENB bit. Before starting the RTC, it should not be in running mode and also hibernate domain should be enabled.

simplesect.title: Related APIs:
simplesect.para: XMC_RTC_Enable(), XMC_RTC_Stop(), XMC_SCU_RESET_DeassertPeripheralReset()
None

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Disables RTC peripheral to start counting time
The function stops the RTC for counting time by resetting CTR.ENB. Before stopping the RTC, hibernate domain should be enabled.

simplesect.title: Related APIs:
simplesect.para: XMC_RTC_Enable(), XMC_RTC_Start(), XMC_SCU_RESET_AssertPeripheralReset()

briefdescription.para: RTC driver for XMC microcontroller family.

detaileddescription.para: Real-time clock (RTC) is a clock that keeps track of the current time. Precise real time keeping is with a 32.768 KHz external crystal clock or a 32.768 KHz high precision internal clock. It provides a periodic time based interrupt and a programmable alarm interrupt on time match. It also supports wakeup from hibernate.
The RTC low level driver provides functions to configure and initialize the RTC hardware peripheral.
